key_points: Hannah Gutierrez-Reed, 'Rust' armorer, was mentored by gun expert Seth Kenney.
Kenney, who owns a weapon and prop rental company, was hired as an 'armorer mentor' for Gutierrez-Reed.
Kenney supplied the firearms and most of the ammunition for the 'Rust' set.
Kenney recommended Gutierrez-Reed for the armorer job and supplied the Colt .45 used by Alec Baldwin when cinematographer Halyna Hutchins was accidentally shot and killed.
Jason Bowles, attorney for Gutierrez-Reed, insists she was extremely safety conscious and did not expect live rounds on set.
Gutierrez-Reed claims to have checked the rounds to ensure they were 'dummies' and locked up the guns, including on the day of the shooting.
Santa Fe County Sheriff's spokesperson Juan RÃ­os could not confirm the Los Angeles Times's reporting.
No live ammunition was supposedly kept on the 'Rust' set, according to Gutierrez-Reed.
Sheriff Adan Mendoza stated that finding a live round on set contradicts Gutierrez-Reed's claim of no live rounds being present.
Filming on 'Rust' has been halted, and an investigation into the incident is ongoing, with no charges filed yet.
spokespersons: Juan Ríos (Sante Fe County Sheriff's spokesperson)
